title: What is the difference between EP and Albums? - Quora

response.answer_text: EPS Estimated length that the industry gives is over 30 minutes or 4 tracks, and there have been numerous double EPs released over time. The release has a total of one to three (1-3) tracks, one or more of the tracks is/are 10 minutes or longer and entire release is less than 30 minutes. The release has a total of four to six (4-6) tracks and the entire release is less than 30 minutes.  VS  ALBUMS “Album” when referring to recorded music dates back to a collection of several 78 RPM records that were actually collected together in a book (album). An album is a release with two 2 - 7 or more tracks will be considered an album, basically a LP that is promoted and sold where Neilsen Soundscan can keep track; also count towards a record contract to being completed. Albums are made by artists but controlled by record labels on every level; even the creation process.

I worked in a record store in college back when we still sold vinyl LPs, and a lot of this terminology dates back to vinyl record albums. An EP was shorter/had fewer cuts than an LP (album). A typical pop music album had 10 to 12 songs, and an EP might have 6 songs. LP stands for “long playing” which was important when people were considering purchasing 78 RPM records or 33 1/3 RPM records; the 33 1/3 records played longer and so you had to change platters less often. EP stands for “extended play” when compared to a 45 RPM single. To really blow your mind, the term “album” when referring to recorded music dates back to a collection of several 78 RPM records that were actually collected together in a book (album).
